intro: Alaticaulia royi, commonly known as the narrow-leaved alaticaulia, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. It produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Alaticaulia royi is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks.
